text:

- Email: benlidailin@gmail.com


University of Toronto
- Major: Economics
- Minors: Statistics and Environmental Studies

Period: September 2020 - June 2024






Summer Analyst, Financial Institutions Group
May 2021 - August 2021

Facilitated effective communication with clients, capturing key information during financial interviews with banks and auto financing institutions.
Assisted in the completion of credit reports by organizing and accurately sorting historical business information and past financial activities.
Maintained clear and concise records for all parties involved by demonstrating strong organizational skills and attention to detail in preparing and maintaining meeting minutes.







Consultant
May 2023 - June 2023

Collaborated with a micro-entrepreneur to overcome operational challenges and boost business revenue, demonstrating problem-solving skills.
Worked in a team to devise and implement effective marketing strategies, demonstrating leadership and teamwork skills.
Led a team effort to digitize the original book-keeping process, enhancing clarity and enabling more insightful analysis of transactions.




Consultant
January 2023 - May 2023

Teamed up with colleagues to conduct research and communicate global ESG trends and policies to a start-up tree planting company.
Collaborated with a team to provide the client with a comprehensive competitive analysis, offering insights into major players and the overall landscape.
Worked in a team to help the client understand large corporations’ ESG investment strategies and communicated how they could leverage these policies to their advantage.






Data Analysis: Proficient in utilizing Pandas library for efficient data cleaning, transformation, and aggregation. Demonstrated strong data management skills.
Web Scraping: Competent in scraping relevant data from various online sources using BeautifulSoup and Requests, demonstrating strong online research skills.
Data Visualization: Skilled in implementing data visualization using matplotlib and GeoPandas to effectively communicate findings, demonstrating strong presentation skills.
Leadership: Proven leadership skills through organizing and managing group members and assigning responsibilities during various projects and extracurricular activities.






Group Leader
October 2017 - October 2020

Contributed to the successful organization of the 2019 Scotiabank Toronto Waterfront Marathon, demonstrating strong community engagement skills.
Demonstrated leadership skills by organizing and managing group members and assigning responsibilities for various marathon stages.




Founder and President
November 2018 - June 2020

Founded a high school table tennis club, demonstrating strong initiative and engagement skills.
Spearheaded the organization of a school-wide table tennis competition, demonstrating strong leadership and teamwork skills.
Implemented innovative fundraising strategies to financially support the competition and promote club visibility, demonstrating strong strategic thinking skills.
Contributed extra funds raised from the event to a local charity group, demonstrating strong community engagement and social responsibility.

text: Welcome to my personal website! Here you can find information about my professional experience, projects, and academic background.

title: About Me
text:
I am an Economics major with minors in Statistics and Environmental Studies at the University of Toronto, boasting a diverse background that blends rigorous academic training with real-world experience. My tenure as a Summer Analyst at China Lianhe Credit Rating Co., Ltd in Beijing was pivotal, enhancing my analytical skills and ability to communicate complex financial information effectively.
My passion for making a tangible impact led me to engage in pro-bono consulting projects, including operational optimization for a micro-entrepreneur in South Africa and strategic advisory for an ESG tree planting start-up in Toronto. These experiences not only honed my problem-solving and strategic thinking but also underscored my commitment to sustainable development and community service.
A fervent advocate for data-driven decision-making, I’ve explored economic factors impacting NYC schools through comprehensive research, employing advanced data management and visualization tools. My dedication extends beyond professional pursuits to community engagement, as evidenced by my leadership roles in the Scotiabank Toronto Waterfront Marathon and founding a high school table tennis club, reflecting my initiative and commitment to social responsibility.
